snippet: Marjorie Scardino will step down after nearly 16 years as head of the company, which owns The Financial Times, the Penguin Group and half of The Economist magazine.
abstract: Marjorie Scardino, chief executive of British media conglomerate Pearson and one of Britain's highest-ranking female executives, will step down after nearly 16 years; John Fallon will replace her; transition raises questions about the future of The Financial Times, which Pearson owns.
lead_paragraph: Marjorie Scardino will step down after nearly 16 years as head of the company, which owns The Financial Times, the Penguin Group and half of The Economist magazine.

headline.main: Scardino, Chief of Pearson, to Step Down
headline.print_headline: Longtime Chief of Pearson, Owner of Financial Times, Is Leaving
